definition: to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: We took the lift to the lobby and heard bangs as the door opened.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐电梯到了前厅，门打开的时候听到砰砰的声音。

sentences.english: Take the stairs instead of the elevator.
Absolutely do not get into an elevator.
She was the same woman who was in the elevator on my way up.
sentences.chinese: 她就是我坐电梯上来时碰到的女人。

sentences.english: Instead of taking the elevator, take the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 与其坐电梯，不如改为爬楼梯吧。

sentences.english: To reach the top of the tower by lift takes just a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 坐电梯到顶楼只要几分钟。

sentences.english: We walked down the stairs instead of taking the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有坐电梯，而是走楼梯下来。

sentences.english: She left the office and took the elevator down.
sentences.chinese: 她离开了办公室，坐电梯下楼。

sentences.english: Take the lift to the third floor and then make a left turn.
Sam and Jonah are to go downstairs in elevator.
sentences.chinese: 山姆和乔那要坐电梯下楼。

sentences.english: Skip the elevator and take the stairs.
When the architect arrived, the managing director took the elevator to the 42nd floor to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 当建筑师到达时，总经理坐电梯上了42楼去迎接他。

sentences.english: Britain left the country, take the elevator right when asking people to stand up.
sentences.chinese: 英国国家靠左行，坐电梯时却要求人们靠右站立。

definition: top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
to take the car, bus, train etc
head of a flight of stairs
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
